reuo.resources.view

Class AsyncLoaderModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • reuo.resources.view.LoaderModel
      • reuo.resources.view.AsyncLoaderModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.swing.ListModel<java.lang.Object>

    public class AsyncLoaderModel
extends LoaderModel
    Provides an asynchronous ListModel for accessing the data of a Loader. This will spawn a background job daemon thread that will handle loading resources and fire an ListDataEvent. While the resource is loading a prototype object will be returned that may be worked with until the background load is completed.

    Pruning

    Loaders do not keep hard references to the resources. When a resource is loaded via the daemon thread a reference must be kept until all of the event listeners have been notified and subsequent call to getElementAt(int) should return the loaded resource. Because of this it is essential that pruneTo(int, int) is called to remove unused references, because otherwise an OutOfMemoryError may occur due to hard references of too many loaded resources.
    Author:
    Kristopher Ives

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AsyncLoaderModel(IndexedLoader<?,?> indexedLoader, java.lang.Object prototype)
      Initializes the asynchronous loader with the provided underlying loader and prototype.
      AsyncLoaderModel(Loader<?> loader, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer> indices, java.lang.Object prototype)
      Initializes the asynchronous loader with the provided underlying loader using indices as a source for valid resource identifiers and the prototype as a temporary object to provide while background loads occur.
